scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The papers contain a manuscript of the poem, "The Day Lily."
Letters and postcards from Perry discuss her writing and its publication, particularly of "That Little Smith Girl;" and the submission of membership and convocation fees to an unnamed organization.
Letter recipients are a Mr. Clay, S. S. McClure, and Eliza Anna Farman Pratt.

did.unittitle: Poem, "The Day Lily," by Nora Perry. n.d.
Nora Perry to Mr. Clay, Providence, Rhode Island 1884 Aug 8

scopecontent.p: Sends a manuscript of one of her stories.

did.unittitle: Nora Perry, Melrose, Highlands, Massachusetts, to [Samuel Sidney] McClure 1884 Oct 27

scopecontent.p: Promises to send a story soon about the length of her story in the June issue of Manhattan.

did.unittitle: Nora Perry, [Russell House], Lexington, Massachusetts, to Mrs. Pratt 1892 May 24

scopecontent.p: Complains about the discrepancy in the date by which the story is needed

did.unittitle: Nora Perry, Boston, Massachusetts, to Mrs. Pratt, [Warner, New Hampshire] 1892 Jul 20

scopecontent.p: Writes that her story is finished and that it is "the most dramatic and full of action of anything" she has even written; discusses plans for sending the manuscript of the story; desires to have a proof immediately or a copy made so that the risk to "valuable property" in long delays is minimal; wishes to make sure that [Samuel Sidney] McClure understands that she does not sell copyrights to her stories.

did.unittitle: Nora Perry, Russell House, Lexington, Massachusetts, to [Samuel Sidney] McClure 1892 Jul 23

scopecontent.p: Writes about her concerns discussed in the July 20th letter to Mrs. Pratt; discusses the manuscript and relates that she has now had it copied while waiting for Mrs. Pratt's reply.

did.unittitle: Nora Perry, Massachusetts, to S[amuel] S[idney] McClure, Tribune Building, New York, New York 1892 Jul 26

scopecontent.p: Requests a note when the package sent by American Express is received by him

did.unittitle: Nora Perry, Russell House, Lexington, Massachusetts, to "Dear Sir." 1892 Aug 8

scopecontent.p: Wishes to remit her fee for membership at this time

did.unittitle: Nora Perry, Russell, Lexington, Massachusetts, to [Samuel Sidney] McClure 1892 Oct 21

scopecontent.p: Request a list of the different papers in which her story is printed and a copy of the story from one of the newspapers

did.unittitle: Nora Perry, Russell House, Lexington, Massachusetts, to [Samuel Sidney] McClure 1892 Oct 30

scopecontent.p: Requests a copy of her story from any other newspaper besides the Boston Globe, specifically the St. Louis Republic; relates her displeasure at the Globe'sapparent procedure to cut and, thereby, mutilate stories
